intro: Dorstenia ekmanii, commonly known as the African mountain star, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. Native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa, it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. The plant features a short, erect stem with alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hair. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are typically pale yellow to white and are borne on long, slender pedicels. Dorstenia ekmanii is a slow-growing plant that requires careful attention to watering and light conditions to flourish.
